DataElement.preferredName: Systemic Lupus Activity Measure Total Score
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric score as a measure of the activity of a lupus patient using the SLAM (Systemic Lupus Activity Measure).

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Measure of the activity of a lupus patient using the SLAM (Systemic Lupus Activity Measure) tool.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A chronic, relapsing, inflammatory, and often febrile multisystemic disorder of connective tissue, characterized principally by involvement of the skin, joints, kidneys, and serosal membranes. It is of unknown etiology, but is thought to represent a failure of the regulatory mechanisms of the autoimmune system. The disease is marked by a wide range of system dysfunctions, an elevated erythrocyte sedimentation rate, and the formation of LE cells in the blood or bone marrow.

Concepts.definition: A chronic, relapsing, inflammatory, and often febrile multisystemic disorder of connective tissue, characterized principally by involvement of the skin, joints, kidneys, and serosal membranes. It is of unknown etiology, but is thought to represent a failure of the regulatory mechanisms of the autoimmune system. The disease is marked by a wide range of system dysfunctions, an elevated erythrocyte sedimentation rate, and the formation of LE cells in the blood or bone marrow.

Property.preferredDefinition: Any form of exercise or movement. Physical activity may include planned activity such as walking, running, basketball, or other sports. Physical activity may also include other daily activities such as household chores, yard work, walking the dog, etc. (from NIDDK Glossary; http://www.niddk.nih.gov/health/nutrit/pubs/glossary/glossaryintro.htm):Measurement; the size or magnitude of something.

Concepts.definition: Any form of exercise or movement. Physical activity may include planned activity such as walking, running, basketball, or other sports. Physical activity may also include other daily activities such as household chores, yard work, walking the dog, etc.
Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Numeric score on a psychometric questionnaire or survey.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Assessment of psychological variables by the application of mathematical procedures.:Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: The science of measuring "psychological" aspects of a person such as knowledge, skills, abilities, or personality. Measurement of these unobservable phenomena is difficult and much of the research and accumulated art of this discipline is designed to reliably define and then quantify.
A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.
